messages.title: 4 Reasons to vote Labour
messages.content: 1. A hardworking, local candidate you can trust. 2. Our public services will not survive under the Tories. 3. Only Labour can deliver an exit from the European Union that protects jobs, workers’ rights and guarantees that EU citizens currently living in the UK have the right to stay. 4. Only Labour can challenge the Tories and deliver a Government that works for the many, not the few.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Aiming to put community's issues, ambitions, and hopes ahead of party lines in Westminster

keyPolicies.policyTitle: Fight for the best of Brexit
keyPolicies.policyDescription: Securing a Brexit deal that includes plans for workers' rights and fair wages, protecting jobs and access to the EU market
Opposing cuts, including in NHS, education, and police, to ensure robust public services

mentions.tacticalSituation: Tactical voting considerations highlighted regarding historical voting patterns in the constituency. Encourages voting for Labour to challenge the Conservative Government and stop the Tories, citing that even a strong Liberal Democrat presence will not lead to a power shift.

issues.brexitEurope: Only Labour can deliver an exit from the European Union that protects jobs, workers’ rights and guarantees that EU citizens currently living in the UK have the right to stay.
issues.health: Our public services like the NHS are in crisis

housing.content: Our public services will not survive under the Tory government. The NHS is in crisis, school budgets are being slashed and our Police and Fire Services are being cut.

images.caption: Image of Anawar Miah with supporters.
Bar chart showing projected vote percentages for Labour (53%), Conservatives (28%), Liberal Democrats (13%), Others (6%). Caption: Only Labour can stop the Tories.
Image of Anawar Miah apparently speaking to constituents.

leaflet.additionalNotes: The leaflet emphasizes the importance of voting Labour to challenge the Conservative government. It warns against split votes due to strong Liberal Democrat support that would not lead to change in government.
